data.title: Drchick3
data.text:
This is the Old railway station, in Hemet. It is small, Free, and is jam packed with local/regional photos, artifacts & historical Information you won't get at Larger Museums, which also charge a hefty admission fee. Souvenirs sold here, are not cheap.. But.. They Are Authentic! 
I think the local schools organize Field Trips, to come here; if not, they should!!

data.title: Very good community museum
data.text: This is one of the best community museums in Riverside County. The displays do a nice job of depicting the valley across it's entire history, and they do it in a tight and efficiently-curated space. The old train depot (similar to the Perris Museum) is a wonderful venue and they've done a much better job of utilizing space including a coffee shop. Parking is conveniently located directly in front of the entrance with plenty of overflow behind the depot.

data.title: Very interesting
data.text: Finally stopped by here after living in the area for over 2 years. It was very interesting and we found out a lot about Hemet and San Jacinto that we didn't know. How it was founded and about the founding families. I really enjoyed our visit.

data.title: Interesting History.
data.text: I did not know such a small place could hold such alot of history. Its worth a stop by to check it out. great folks working their as well.

data.title: Loved it here
data.text: This was before the big rehab they are doing but the food was excellent and such a good price. They had entertainment on certain days which was really cool and the atmosphere was so kick back.

data.title: Top 5 places to go in Hemet
data.text: The amount of knowledge this place has is insane and to think about all the old artifacts they have is just so interesting as well... You cant help but to love the old western pictures and buildings that once stood on within the valley are destroyed or ruined.. some by earthquakes some by fire.

data.title: Worth a look when in Hemet
data.text: Guide was very helpful and you could be as leisurely as you liked. The history of Hemet book is worthwhile purchasing if you are new to the area. Lots of interesting sections in a small space and now has a kiosk as well.

data.title: Time to stop and remember history
data.text: Drive by here often and then they made a cade to go with the museum. Bery nice atmosphere.. Great coffee

data.title: Hemet Museum
data.text: Interesting Hemet history, information about the lake, Hemet people and the bones of animals that were found during the lake's construction. However, I've lived in Hemet all my life so probably why I found it so interesting, not sure how interesting out of towners will find it.

data.title: History of Hemet housed in an iconic, historic train station
data.text:
The volunteers at the Hemet Museum are an enthusiastic bunch who are constantly striving to improve the quality of the exhibits. Many antique photos of Hemet have recently been beautifully mounted. There are antique farming implements and articles of clothing, as well as Native American artifacts collected in the area. Ramona Pageant posters and photos abound. 

The docents can answer just about any question about Hemet that you can think to ask!  Books about Hemet are available for purchase.

The museum building itself is worth the visit. It's a restored train depot in the center of town. There used to be a little sandwich and yogurt shop at one end of the building, but it is closed now.
